cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 30 miles east of Havana, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Moving northwest tonight, turning north–northwest on Tuesday and then north to north-northeast Wednesday, skirting the Florida Keys and running up the west coast of Florida toward the Big Bend before crossing inland and accelerating up the U.S. East Coast.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast (near Cedar Key/Aucilla River area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch from west of Ochlockonee River to Indian Pass, FL (Gulf side)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from Flamingo northward to Ochlockonee River on Florida’s west coast; Storm-Surge Warning Bonita Beach to Aucilla River including Tampa Bay
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire west coast of Florida, Florida Keys, then coastal Georgia and the Carolinas, eventually the Mid-Atlantic and New England coasts
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Unlikely on the Atlantic side; surge focus is Gulf coast
weather_observation.wind: Intermittent tropical-storm-force gusts (35–45 mph) possible in squalls Wednesday as Elsa crosses the peninsula.
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches widespread with locally higher amounts to 6 inches; risk of flash and urban flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes possible across the Florida Peninsula on Tuesday and Wednesday.
